Description: The COVID pandemic brought to light the need for efforts to promote health equity in the USA and the world. As a result of this, there has been an explosion of initiatives promoting diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) throughout the USA, including academic institutions, government and corporations. As the COVID pandemic wanes, there will be a need for efforts to assure the sustainability of these newly implemented DEI initiatives. In this session, we will hear from DEI leaders at Cancer Centers and junior scientists involved in DEI efforts and have a robust discussion on this very important topic.
Location: Junior Ballroom G - Rosen Centre Hotel
SearchResultBody: CDF02. Minorities in Cancer Research Career Development Forum: How to Sustain Efforts Promoting Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) in the Post-COVID Era
